intro: Brossaea insipida, commonly known as the pale brossaea, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring, adding a subtle beauty to its natural habitat. Due to its limited distribution and specific environmental requirements, Brossaea insipida is considered endangered and is often found in specialized botanical gardens.
